result.execSummary:
The defendant James E. Boos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Unlawful Phone Use-Threaten w/ Obscenity [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.012(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Lincoln County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with RH or any of her children that are not also defendant's children unless agreed upon by parties and Probation Agent

Counseling as recommended by agent
60 days jail stayed and used at the discretion of Probation Agent for any rules violations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James E. Boos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody with attorney Tina M Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Revocation summary has been received -  Victim requirements have been complied with - No corrections noted on revocation summary - Arguments by Bayne-Allison/Abernethy-Mays/Defendant/Court
15CM127 - 6 months jail with huber - Jail credit 262 days - 137 original credit plus 125 on holds
15CF180 - 90 days jail with huber - Jail credit 363 days - 238 days original credit plus 125 days 
Civil judgment for unpaid court obligations
Sentencing hearing on revocation on June 6, 2017 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 15CM180 and 15CM127 - 
15CF180 - Motion to amend to Misd. unlawful use of telephone 947.012(1)(b) - Plea no contest -
15CF127 - Plea no contest to count as charged - 
15CM180 Plea No contest to count 1 - Count 2 DRI -
Waiver of rights and tendering plea - Waiver free and voluntary - Factual basis exists for plea - Found guilty by court -  
Statements by victim to sentencing - Statements by Dunphy/Mays/Court to sentencing
Sentence withheld - 24 months probation each count concurrent - No contact with RH or any of her children that are not also defendant's children unless agreed upon by parties and PO - Counseling as recommended by agent - CC/Surcharges on each case - (No additonal jail ordered) 60 days jail stayed and used at discretion of PO for any rules violations -  No agreement on jail credit at this time - Post conviction rights given

Defendant James E. Boos in court via video, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by Abernethy-Mays - Arguments by Mays regarding bond modificatin - Response by Dunphy - Defendant states he may be able to post $200 - Court amends bond to $200 cash with balance of signature and all conditions will remain -
Motion hearing on March 14, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody with attorney James Lex (specially).  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by Probation P.B. - Statements by Dunphy - Statements by Lex - Court finds the defendant has served his one year - JOC should state the conditional jail time has been served - 
15CF180 - Arguments by Dunphy/Lex to bail modification - Court denies motion to reduce bond on this case - Remains at $500 cash with $1500 sig and all conditions remain

Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Blade Mikula called - Sworn - Direct by Dunphy - Cross by Abernethy-Mays - Stipulation to defendant being in custody from 12/8/14 to 6/4/15 - Arguments by Dunphy/Abernethy-Mays - Court finds probable cause that a felony had been committed and binds defendant over for further proceedings - Information filed with court - In receipt of information - Waive reading - Plea not guilty - Bond continued  Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 10:55 am.

Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements by Dunphy - Witness is not in court - State requests adjournment - Attorney Mays objects to adjournment - Court grants States motion for adjournment - Court will not modify bond at this time -  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Time limits for hearing preliminary hearing waived - State does not object to adjourning preliminary hearing - Waiver of time limits is free and voluntary - Arguments by Abernethy-Mays regarding bail - Response by Dunphy - Bond continued  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant James E. Boos in court, in custody.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint - Right to counsel - Waive reading - Dunphy to bail - Statements by defendant - Court sets $2500 bond, $500 cash with $2000 sig bond - No contact with RLH  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.
